The first step of the project was to designate a leader of the group. He would be responsible for the SD card. In our group the leader was Naherry. We can say that he played his role perfectly since he did not lose the SD card. Beyond that, he also downloads a virtual machine which will allow us to do numerous tests before the class sessions.
**<a name=part_1></a>Installing the operating system**

Before we could achieve the goal of the project we had to download an operating system to our raspberry. We decided to install the Rasbian 400 operating system from the official raspberry website.
Thanks to an adapter which made the connection between a USB port and an SD card we finally managed to install our OS. 

The next step was to gain access to the raspberry to configure it. But before that we had to be able to open it on an IUT screen. At this point we had some difficulty because we never used a raspberry. 
We finally understood how to do it : first we connected the raspberry keyboard to the screen with an HDMI cable then we connected the keyboard to another PC at the IUT in order to have access to the internet.
We now had access to the raspberry and could continue its configuration.
**<a name=part_2></a>Raspberry configuration**

During the first part of the configuration we add new users in order to take charge of the support. The following command was used to add some users : 

>sudo adduser Username

Afterwards we updated the raspberry time with the following command :
sudo timedatectl set-time "2024-01-23 8:45:00"

We also faced another problem. The keyboard is originally in QWERTY format. So to modify this we used the raspberry interface without using the terminal. The interface was also used to modify the passwords of the session student and to configure the SSH parameters.
Finally we downloaded mariadb to model the database. For this the following command was used :  sudo apt-install mariadb-server
**<a name=part_3></a>Data base managment**

**<a name=part_3_1></a>Configuration of mariadb server**

First we created a new MySQL session to model the database with this
order:
>[!NOTE] 
>sudo mysql -u root –p

Then we created a new user and a password associated with this user : 

CREATE USER 'prof'@'10.42.0.1' IDENTIFIED BY 'pwdprof';

In order to save the changes made we then used this command : 

GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON *.* TO 'prof'@'10.42.0.1';

Now we would like to connect from any device to the server we just created. For this we must modify the appropriate configuration directory changing the "bind-address" setting to allow connections on all interfaces, and restarting the MariaDB service to apply the changes. These commands follow this reasoning : 

>1. cd .. 
>2. cd etc/mysql		
>3. grep -r bind-address ./ 
>4. nano mariadb.config.d/50-server.cnf	
>5. sudo systemctl restart mariadb

Then we can login with the following order : sudo mysql -u prof –p

**<a name=part_3_2></a>Creation of data base**

The following SQL instructions were carried out from the terminal in order to create the database : 

>1. CREATE TABLE CAMPING.CAMPING (
NumCamping INT PRIMARY KEY,
NomCamping VARCHAR(255),
AddrCamping VARCHAR(255),
TelCamping VARCHAR(10),
DateOuv DATE,
DateFerm DATE,
NbEtoiles INT,
QualitéFrance VARCHAR(50));
>2. CREATE TABLE CAMPING.ACTIVITE (
NumActivité INT PRIMARY KEY,
NomActivité VARCHAR(255),
TypeActivité VARCHAR(255));
>3. CREATE TABLE CAMPING.ACTICAMPING (
NumCamping INT,
NumActivité INT,
PrixActivité FLOAT,
PRIMARY KEY(NumCamping,NumActivité));

Adding foreign keys. (This was done like this because we were unable to add the foreign key when creating the table)


>1. ALTER CAMPING.ACTICAMPING ADD FOREIGN KEY (NumCamping) REFERENCES CAMPING.CAMPING (NumCamping);
>2. ALTER CAMPING.ACTICAMPING ADD FOREIGN KEY (NumActivité) REFERENCES CAMPING.ACTIVITE (NumActivité);

**<a name=part_3_3></a>Data insertion**

The following instructions were carried out from the terminal in order to fill the database with data : 


>This is a standard NOTE block.


>1. INSERT INTO CAMPING.CAMPING VALUES
(1,'Le Paradis','123 Rue de la Forêt','0123456789','2023-05-01','2023-10-31',4,'Excellente'),
(2,'Belle Nature','456 Avenue des Montagnes','9876543210','2023-06-15','2023-09-30',3,'Bonne');
>2. INSERT INTO CAMPING.ACTIVITE VALUES
( 101, 'Randonnée pédestre', 'Plein air'),
( 102, 'Escalade', 'Aventure'),
( 103, 'Yoga', 'Bien-être');
>3. INSERT INTO CAMPING.ACTICAMPING VALUES
( 1, 101, 20.50),
( 1, 102, 15.75),
( 2, 101, 18.00);
